website_summaries.verdict: Use the pixel with Android or Apple devices and simply press it to find your phone when you've dropped it between couch cushions.
pros: The battery can be replaced on this little lightweight tracker that's easy to set up and use
It lights up in addition to beeping and the audible alerts are loud enough to hear from afar
cons: The app's map isn't always accurate

customer_reviews.title: Found a Lost Cat!  Thank You!
customer_reviews.text: The Trackr pixel potentially saved my elderly cat's life. She slipped out of the house during a furniture delivery a week ago, and needs daily medication, and we were frantic to find her, but she was scared and wouldn't come when we called. The Pixel on her collar allowed my husband and I to figure out where in the neighborhood she was hiding, and get her home safely. That's amazing to me. Every pet needs one of these on their collars, mine definitely will.
customer_reviews.author: Haus Hivemind

customer_reviews.title: Have extra batteries on hand.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the competition but I did the math on battery replacement and this seemed like a no brainier. I bought a pack of pixel and also a twenty pack of batteries here on Amazon. As batteries wear out they replace for free, but since I already have some on hand there's no delay. I'm really happy with how easy it is to find my keys, where I parked my car, where my insurance information is for my motorcycle. Paying attention to battery status is painless and swapping takes about five seconds once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Koygo

customer_reviews.title: Small but POWERFUL and super cool device...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first review here on Amazon, and I'm only writing it because this is a phenomenal product. I am constantly traveling for work related purposes, I slap this thing on luggage and never worry again. I've tested it out on pet collars too and it worked perfectly. I was skeptical at first but now that I have one, I think I'll be getting more for family and friends. This thing is super tiny and doesn't bulk up existing key chains, etc. It's affordable and worth the purchase if you're having any doubts. Attached is a pic of it on my current key chain so you can see how small but useful this thing is.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great product, haven’t lost my keys since buying it.
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a kevo digital lock so I don’t have to carry my keys everywhere but the change in routine actually resulted leaving my keys at a friends house over an hour away on two separate occasions. I researched the other products out there and went with trackr because the batteries are replaceable, the application on iOS is much better than the alternatives and the size of the network. Pairing with my phone was simple and i’ve Even helped someone else find a lost item already.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Very cool! I like the extra LED lights to help ...
customer_reviews.text: As a longtime TrackR customer, I'm excited to have the TrackR Pixel protecting my stuff. Technically this isn't my first Pixel. I received one at a local TEDx event, customized with the TEDx logo. Very cool! I like the extra LED lights to help me find hidden items. I'm planning to enable the TrackR Alexa skill too!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Panesis

customer_reviews.title: No more lost keys! Aging forgetfulness a thing of the past...maybe.
customer_reviews.text: Being of a certain age I sometimes forget where I have placed certain items. After purchasing and using the Trackr I suspect that I have solved some of my forgetfulness, at least concerning my car keys. The unit is small and quickly added to my key chain using the strong nylon strap hooked to the unit. Also easy to add the app to my smart phone. Best of all this unit works both ways....if I have my keys but can't find my phone I can easily use the button on the trackr to make my phone ring....awesome! I think my husband is in line for the next trackr!
customer_reviews.author: karhaut

customer_reviews.title: Findable, sort of.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would track in GPS using my phone's GPS as reference. Um, not so much. It listed the location on the map a few blocks over from where my phone actually was. It wasn't a time lag problem like it gave a location where it had been seen because the spot it picked on the map was in a neighborhood where I haven't even been. I also was hoping that the tracker would help find my phone. It will, if you have the app open all the time. The ringer on the item is also not very loud.
customer_reviews.author: John Longmire

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Separation Alert Device!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup with Trakr App from Google Play (works with Android phones). Bought because I had a couple scares when I left my cell phone behind. This device MITIGATES this problem by chirping when distance to cell phone exceeds Bluetooth range (approximately 70 feet in my experience to date). Device has additional functionality as described. Would DEFINITELY this product again if needed. Does have a replaceable battery, but I couldn't open it to peek (there are YouTube videos on tricks to open). To conserve device battery life, keep your phone's Bluetooth OFF when separation alert function is not needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ann-Marie

customer_reviews.title: Better than Tile by far.
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research and concluded that this was the best overall tracker at the right price. Bought the five pack and am very glad I did. I had purchased a TILE for my daughters keys and in less than a year she received a low battery warning and the discount they offered for a new unit (can’t change the battery) was not worth it. TrackR with its free battery replacement and easy to use app is the best. Period. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J. Correia

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with any Android phones I tried
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a birthday present for my wife. It did not work with her phone. Would connect / disconnect / connect / repeat. Tried everything possible. Tried it with other Android phones in the house with same results. Never could get it to work even though other devices work fine with headphones, watches, cars, variety of Bluetooth devices. It looked like a winner would loud sound, replaceable battery and flashing lights but since it could not stay connected we had to return it. I will continue my quest for one that works well with Android.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: I did not have good luck with this product
customer_reviews.text: I did not have good luck with this product, out of the box I was pleased, everything seemed to work very well, found my keys, dog, wallet, wifes purse. Next day battery warnings on all but one tag. Replaced battery but could not get sensors to work. Followed the instructions got them to work, than lost contact again. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SteveGord

customer_reviews.title: Cheap because it is USELESS
customer_reviews.text: I thought this might be an option to Tile’s Sticker device. USELESS: A tiny weak string to knot onto a device, no way. Does not have Adhesive Ability like Tile’s Sticker Good luck checking the battery compartment to see if this arrived DOA or not Into the trash. Amazon should be embarrassed allowing this device to be sold on their site. Thankfully, there are court cases winding through the courts to provide that product liability will apply to them as enablers of products vs the shield they use now to dodge responsibility
customer_reviews.author: FD Firefighter 121

customer_reviews.title: Works easily, but battery replacement is tough and not actually free
customer_reviews.text: The Trackr seems to work well and the volume when you're searching is pretty loud. There's no sound alert or notification when the battery is low/dead though, so if you aren't keeping an eye out for it, you may not discover it is dead until you need to use it. The "free" battery wasn't free. It was $1.99 and the shipping was free. Not terrible, but definitely not at all what they advertise which was frustrating and impacted the score I gave them. The battery in the Pixel is also really difficult to replace. There are several recommendations on ifixit.com (the tape method ended up working for me).
customer_reviews.author: Breezie

customer_reviews.title: Lost keys are a thing of the past
customer_reviews.text: This is my second trackr, this version is small and has an LED light. it lets you find the item it is attached to or lets you find your phone if you have the trackr. I got an alert that I helped somebody else find their item when my phone app detected their trackr. That is super cool!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: If your place is as messy as mine, you NEED this to find your phone or your keys.
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a gift for my parents so they could get help finding their keys or phones. I ended up keeping one for myself. I really like that you can use your phone to find your pixel OR if you have the pixel in hand you can ring your misplaced phone. The app allows you to see when you are getting "warmer" (closer to the pixel device).
customer_reviews.author: Joel Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Great product. great price.
customer_reviews.text: So, I am not sure about the longevity of this product, but it was a great price for what they offer. As i always loose my keys... or wallet... or dog. I was stoked to keep this on my keys for the next time i lost them. However, I should have notices how flimsy the string was that they send it with... sadly, i actually lost or misplaced the object somehow... And my the time i notices, i think the battery was dead or something... because i try to call it and make it play its tune... and it just wont sound off. But yes, i would still recommend for those of us that loose our important things constantly.
customer_reviews.author: B.B. Rifle

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Found my keys a couple times
customer_reviews.text: I bought three on Black Friday. Placed one on my keychain and in the process of linking it to my phone messed up the name. So I deleted it, thinking I could link it again with a new name. Never worked again--one down. I paired a second one and linked it to my phone. Worked great. Found my keys a couple times. I liked it. After about three weeks of hanging on my key chain, it fell apart and wouldn't work again--two down. So I'm ready to link up my next one but at this rate, it would be cheaper to have new locks put on the house every time I lose my keys than pay for more TrackRs.
customer_reviews.author: B. S. T.

customer_reviews.title: Could be bettter
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3. Hooking it up is really easy but if you need to sync it to another phone instead you have to remove the battery to re-do it. Also it’s kind of delicate. One of them dropped on the ground (attached to keys) and the cover came off, battery popped out and its broken. I need something durable.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Battery need to be replaced every month or so.
customer_reviews.text: The device worked great for about a month and then it has had 'connection' issues due to a low battery. I have changed the battery several times with the same issue. I have had this same battery issue with all my devices from this company. The customer service is nearly impossible to contact as the chat application in the application has never worked for me and the number they have left on negative reviews is no longer valid. I would not recommend this product, or company, to anyone. I rarely leave negative reviews but this product warrants one.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Shrimplin

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant experience from out of the box to set-up and beyond.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I was impressed by the packaging and the added accessories.Everything was well organized and well-planned. I was also impressed by how easy it was to pair each TrackR to my Galaxy Note 8 smartphone. Interesting gadgets such as this often are a challenge to pair and to use initially, but these items didn't present a learning curve or require time and research to use out of the box. I have been very happy with my purchase thus far. I will recommend them to friends and acquaintances as something that can be very useful and handy.
customer_reviews.author: dhens9253

customer_reviews.title: Amazing trackers!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! So many times I’ve lost something and wished I had put these babies on the item but there are only so many. They are so cool. Wish there was a way to make the sound louder if it’s lost in a deep couch the sound is hard to locate. And I wish the battery lasted longer or warned better them almost dead. But I do love these for the inconvenience of “honey, where’s the remote!?! 😡you had it last!🤬” and put one on my sons phone since he is irresponsible and cent recall where he leaves it once it’s dead. I need to buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Corrine`

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing - I ended up buying Tile
customer_reviews.text: I purchased several of these and they failed within two weeks, indicating dead batteries. When I pried the battery case apart, the inside was severely damaged. I purchased another set, thinking it'd been some kind of error. The same thing happened, and even those that didn't show damage simply stopped working. I replaced with brand-name batteries and yet still did not work. I ended up buying Tiles and those have worked great. Unfortunate!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It needs work on the alert tone to locate it.
customer_reviews.text: I just received the TrackR pixel today. It was very simple to pair with my iphone 7plus. So far it works as designed, but right off the bat, I do not like the sound it makes when you locate it. It is a very high pitched tone, which you can not pinpoint where the sound is coming from. And it isn’t very loud, if it was under clothes or something similar, I doubt you would hear it. Other than the alert sound, it seems to work. If the sound was different, I would give it 5 stars, but I am only giving it 3, because this could be a flaw that could prevent you from locating your item.
customer_reviews.author: RickyC

customer_reviews.title: They don’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted this to work as I have a bad habit of leaving my keys at work and now home at home. Unfortunately these don’t work. They become unpaired, they go off randomly even when they’re right next to the phone, they don’t go off when they’re supposed to, setting up the number of rings doesn’t do anything either. In short, nothing works as it should. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John Dough

customer_reviews.title: Not loud enough
customer_reviews.text: Not only is it not loud enough to hear,it also alarms just whenever it wants. Wish I would have splurged and spent more or bought cheaper in hopes of better luck. Too much trouble to return or that is what I would do.Update...dropped to one star first a little piece broke off the cover then a week or so later noticed the entire cover was gone. So you only want this if you treat your keys like fine crystal
customer_reviews.author: Garey C.

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad but it does not pinpoint exactly where the missing item (or pet) is, just gives you a general location. Also, there does not seem to be a way to turn off the alarm unless you turn off the wifi on the phone. If the battery is running down, then it will repeatedly beep unless you turn off wifi or remove the item completely from the setup on the app. Make sure you have spare batteries ready! Also, the website says it's not good to track pets or cars.
customer_reviews.author: Meadow Wonderland

customer_reviews.title: Best of Its Kind!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product!! It helped me find my laptop since my Find My Mac doesn't work for some weird reason. I like the loud ring and the LED lights a lot. It was also simple to set up... literally only took like 10 seconds. I had Tile before, but got rid of it since it doesn't have a replaceable battery like the Pixel. The photos were taken in the sun, so it doesn't look as bright, but anyway, I hope this helps everyone else out there!
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work-came with dead batteries
customer_reviews.text: No idea if these work or not as al three batteries are dead. We will have to order batteries and see if they will work and then I can update my review. Really disappointed to have a Christmas present come with dead batteries. Also they are VERY hard to open to replace the batteries!
customer_reviews.author: neelah rae

customer_reviews.title: The 5 black Pixels on Amazon came with dead batteries, still a good deal though
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to try them out yet because all but 1 of the 5 were not functional because of dead batteries, see pics. These batteries should be at least 3 volts but the highest one was 2.84 volts. That said, it's still a great deal at $12.99 for 5. I will see if TrackR supplies free replacement batteries as stated on their website. I've also ordered 15 CR2016 cells off Amazon just in case. Updates to come ...
customer_reviews.author: Truth C Ker

customer_reviews.title: Not good for keys. Works well for Apple TV remote.
customer_reviews.text: I’ll give it two stars because the one my Apple TV remote has served our family well. The ones that traveled outside of the house with our keys didn’t hold up so well. Over just 3-4 months they stopped producing an audible sound, even after battery replacement. I’d say they are ok if kept inside and away from any moisture that would occur taking them outside the home. Also not as loud as tiles. I’ll stick to tile for keys, and TrackR for things like remotes.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuyTN

customer_reviews.title: Batteries Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I had the older version of trackr. It was OK . It didn;t always work . However after 2 years they all died. I ordered this new version. What garbage. Batteries on some were dead on arrival. I ordered EIGHT of these trackrs. There is nobody to talk to...chat is not what I want. And nobody was around to chat with. I cant; believe they don;t have an 800 phone #. CHat? really? And the battery should not be dead from day one. I can;t open the back to remove and replace the battery. Returned and bought a Tile......so much better.
customer_reviews.author: bejenin

customer_reviews.title: ... Trackr that I ordered and so far 2 have bad batteries and one that was attached to my keys ...
customer_reviews.text: I have opened 4 of the 8 Trackr that I ordered and so far 2 have bad batteries and one that was attached to my keys opened up and now I lost a good battery and the back screw on cover. I will say that they do seem to function nice if you buy new batteries and are lucky enough to not have them open up on you. And I will also add that I do not throw my keys and I did properly replace the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service; Small device; Poor quality materials
customer_reviews.text: It does what I need it to do, but all of the batteries had to be replaced in the 5 piece kit within a few months (not close to a year), and at least one of them just completely fell apart when I was trying to replace the battery. Luckily, the customer service is very good, so I got free replacement batteries and a replacement for the one that fell apart, but if you're looking for something that is both durable and reliable 100% of the time, the technology may not be out there to make it as small as the TrackR pixel yet.
customer_reviews.author: sillylittleTpot

customer_reviews.title: Good product you guys have
customer_reviews.text: I bought some of the bravo devices too. Gave this pixel one to my girlfriend and it helps a ton when she's rifling around in her purse for her keys. She's used it most often to do kind of a reverse search and find her phone. Good product you guys have!
customer_reviews.author: Zander

customer_reviews.title: Had to contact support to reset my info several times due to software issues
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to give negative reviews but this one has nothing good to say. Had to contact support and they had to reset my acct several times due to app malfunctions. I have tried to use the product but when you press the button to locate, it sends a beeping noise to the tracking part. I don't want attention drawn to my lost keys if they are laying in a parking lot. I just tracked my keys on the app and it says they are 15 mins away from me but they are actually in my purse next to me. Would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Used this Tracker pixel for quit a while, works great very easy to set up, always a help when I misplaced my keys, so bought another to use for my Wallet , Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: naftali

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: as a person who loses his key 24/7 this little invention saved my life, its either i am losing my phone or the key and with the trackR i can either ring my keys through the phone and my phone through the key this is a life-saving invention for everyone who loses their key often my next move is to get one for my wallet as well.
customer_reviews.author: Oren

customer_reviews.title: Replaceable Battery!
customer_reviews.text: I was using the Tiles before purchasing a TrackR. I must say the TrackR is much better when it comes to having to find it. I believe it's more accurate than the Tile. So I did make the switch to TrackR and purchased several more. What's also nice is you can replace the TrackR batteries. With the Tiles you cannot, once they're dead, they are then useless. So TrackR's will also save you money in the long run. Battery life for Tile and TrackR is one year.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: Instructions letters ridiculous small. Downloaded app, couldn’t find it because of notification battery was low, notification free battery, to pay shipping. Took apart “impossible to put back together. “Pissed off”
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: This just didn't work out for us
customer_reviews.text: My wife tends to lose things sometimes in the house, but just as often in the car or some restaurant. I thought this would operate like a GPS, I guess like Tile's product does? I tied the notifications to my own cell phone since she often misplaces her whole purse, but got so many nuisance notifications that I had walked away from her purse that I pried the tracking device off her phone after just a few days' use. I don't think it's operation is properly made clear on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: RAB

customer_reviews.title: Non-Functioning
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three devices. All three came with dead batteries. When the app was installed on my phone and the devices set up, there was a message on how to order replacement batteries. I did that (3+ weeks ago) and still have not received the batteries nor a follow up of any kind. There are MANY other competitive product on the market. I am sorry that I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: lkuril

customer_reviews.title: Free Battery for Nothing - 4 out of 5 Arrived with Dead or Low Batt
customer_reviews.text: 4 out of 5 Arrived with Dead or Low Battery. And the free battery program is kind of stupid. When 4 out of 5 need battery, I can only order one at a time. It's frustrating when you have to buy new batteries for brand new products that just arrive. The search function works well around the house. I haven't yet tried on the street if I lost something. The battery only last 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: BR-Anxiem

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but I was so frustrated and disappointed by this product, which at the time I purchased it, had 4stars. The Bluetooth connectivity was terrible. The few times it worked was when I was practically on top of the tracker. When I tested it out to locate items in an adjoining room, it worked only a fraction of the time. I would not trust this to work in case of actually needing to find something, especially if in a hurry. It was incredibly frustrating to try to open to get to battery, as well. Overall, not a product that I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: These are small and work!
customer_reviews.text: Wor4ks pretty well, not as good as Tiles, but - otoh - much cheaper. Doesn't ring my phone near long enough, but it has helped me find my keys. Good stocking presents. Hard to put in new batteries until you really learn the trick. Also hard to push the signal to make it ring the phone. But...it works and will lead you around "getting warmer, warmer, getting colder, etc". I have them on all my keys and a remote too. I'm a big mis-placer person.
customer_reviews.author: Mammoot

customer_reviews.title: I tried to love them...
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of being able to replace the batteries and the same size that came with a key loop and stickers. Unfortunately that’s where the love ended. The TrackR that is connected to my keys can’t ever seem to find my phone and my phone can only find it about 50% of the time. There is nothing more frustrating then finding my keys and phone in almost the same spot but they can’t “locate” each other. I thought I was going to be a Tile convert...but reliability wins out in this case.
customer_reviews.author: GFreeinPA

customer_reviews.title: Good product, very short battery life w/ expensive replacements
customer_reviews.text: I like these WAY more than Tile. The battery is replaceable, they light up, and the app actively tells you if you’re getting “hotter or colder” when looking for your device. The only downside is that my TrackRs were delivered with low batteries, so I had to replace the batteries within the first month. But, that’s simple and only costs a few bucks for all three TrackRs. UPDATE: Dropping the stars WAY down. The battery only lasts about a month on these things, and while it’s replaceable, that gets expensive fast.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nix

customer_reviews.title: Great product for forgetful and busy people, just be careful where you put it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, I've already found a lost water bottle within the first few days of setting up my pixels! The only caveat is the limited range of the bluetooth connection and the incessant notifications from the pixel (one was placed in my wallet and when sitting down the small button on the pixel would be activated and would constantly buzz my phone). Otherwise, great product for forgetful people and busy people alike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked nicely for the first few days...
customer_reviews.text: But when I really needed to use it and find my keys, my phone says it's trying to connect and does not. Messages of a critically low battery. Please order a free battery, but they'll need to charge me for shipping and handling. Its only been 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: eighty7

customer_reviews.title: Separation Anxiety
customer_reviews.text: I purchased, as price point better than tile and ability to replace batteries. When I received and learned about separation feature, I thought this would be great. It isn't. The phone and TrackR continually go off, as they assume they are more than 100 feet apart. get out of car with wallet in pocket and phone in other pocket phone and TrackR both starts. Had to finally turn off this feature. Also, the crowd search continually pings me, as my phone continually connects. So, I turned off this notification too. Once these batteries die, I will be on search for another option, as the TrackR features are worse than Tiles.
customer_reviews.author: Elmoze

customer_reviews.title: Best Device ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Best device ever. My wife is always loosing her keys. I bought this for her for Christmas and works like a charm. I even put one on my keys and it helps me locate my phone laying around the house as well. Everyone should have one of these and the network keeps growing. I live in a rural area but there are lots of folks using these and the crowd locate feature is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: J Weir

customer_reviews.title: Do not work as advertised. Has a very limited use.
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely a scam. The devices do not work as advertised. I purchased 6 of them and non of them work. Do not buy this product you will be wasting your money. The devices will only connect if you have the app open, useless for finding your phone, kinda works the other way. They state that the range on the Bluetooth should be 100 feet. It is actually about 4 feet so you have to know the location of you lost item to get it to connect to it. Don't know how they can keep getting away with the false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Otte

customer_reviews.title: if it can go without be replaced constantly i will be incredibly happy despite the Android app being a bit buggy during ...
customer_reviews.text: So far its met my expectations, however i will be waiting to finalize the review base on the the battery life in the trackr, if it can go without be replaced constantly i will be incredibly happy despite the Android app being a bit buggy during setup (using Android 8.0 atm) Update: Sadly the battery life was about 3 months, i just saw mine got the low-battery warning recently. So about half of what i was hoping for. Oh well. still aint too bad a product
customer_reviews.author: NMG

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Keept beeping and I was next to my keys, sometimes this tracker went bonkers. I would recommend a more pricey one because this didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Anahi Castillejos

customer_reviews.title: Poor tracker
customer_reviews.text: I have to be standing next to it for it to work. If I lose my keys in the kitchen and I am looking for them in my room or the living room, then It won't work. Also, it does not work the other way around. My phone does not ring when trying to use the tracker on my keys. Also after 3 months, the tracker fell apart
customer_reviews.author: marisol gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: and I am glad that I did
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time thinking about these before purchasing, and I am glad that I did! I don't normally loose my keys but I love this product! I have put them on both sets of keys and my Apple TV remote which is always ending up in odd places. All three pixels were easy to set up and they are loud enough to hear from anywhere! I really enjoy the search for phone feature and that it can be used with Alexa. The lights are great for the dark and the button is not accidentally pushed in my pocket. I would recommend this product to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: JakeJollI

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Went through all of them in a period of less than 2 years. They're not even remotely durable and stop beeping after just a couple of months on a keychain. Battery life is awful, and now they're charging $5 for shipping for the "free" replacement batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Dammerung

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE- LOW BATTERY
customer_reviews.text: The track are worked for exactly 8 days. When you open the app it now tells you to reorder batteries. Shouldn't the battery lasts more than 8 days? It can only find your objects if there's Wi-Fi and therefore Bluetooth. Stuck in a mall stuck, in a parking lot, it won't work.
customer_reviews.author: cl anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great but could use Alexa improvements
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I like these a lot. We wish there was an ability to use Alexa integration with two phones. She can only be integrated on one account and even when we out both pixels on the same account, she can only make one phone ring. She also can only make a phone ring. Only the app can make the pixels make a sound. We have found a work around using the app to find the phone that Alexa can't make ring, but it would've been nice to have Alexa find both phones and the keys.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi P

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with a dead battery
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s great that they will replace the batteries for free but I literally pushed the button on mine twice before I got the “critically low battery” notification. So now I have to wait 15 days or so and may eventually have a product that works. Oh and the price dropped $3 right after I got it. Honestly, returning it and buying a new one is probably a better option than waiting 15 days for a battery to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Salemka

customer_reviews.title: Unnecessary notifications when item is in my hand.
customer_reviews.text: Title says it, I am connected, item is in my hands and supposedly other users are finding my item inside my house. I bought it because my dog runs around to see the neighbors and needed a better way to find him. Unfortunately, unless both items are on the same Bluetooth connection you will not find your objects. I am also prone to leaving my cell at work, I have one on there to keep track...nope. Hard to connect, unreliable and better products on the market.
customer_reviews.author: B.M.PATTERSON

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Like many others have stated, right out of the box these things didn’t work...!would even turn on. I have used TrackR in the past with no issues. Idk what happened to them but I am very disappointed. These were affordable and got the job done. Tile here I come!!!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Not a great experience
customer_reviews.text: So I Had this product for about two months and the reason I waited so long to do a review was because when I first got the product, automatically it was low battery so I thought maybe I can get it in the store somewhere cheaper and it’s more than one. so I waited then I just decided OK I will just order from them so when I finally got the battery I was happy excited ready for it and then like 2 to 3 days later it says I need a new battery.
customer_reviews.author: Dorthy Ray

customer_reviews.title: TrackR Pixel
customer_reviews.text: I have just recently received the TrackR but it is doing everything as advertised. Very light weight and unobtrusive. Would make a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Spirit Feynman

customer_reviews.title: This product can't stand up to daily use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 8 pack to give as Christmas presents. Of the set, one came complaining of a low battery. I was able to request a free replacement and it works fine now. They seem to work fine other than that. I'll update with long term usability. Update: The 2 that I use, and the 2 that I gave my Dad have failed already. 5 months out. One is lost around the house with a set of keys, the other three simply stopped working. Changing batteries doesn't help. I'm too embarrassed to ask the other members of the family how their's are working.
customer_reviews.author: Ohlen Corbett

customer_reviews.title: TrackR for W
customer_reviews.text: Such a handy little device. I have one on my keys, laptop, and one in my wallet. The separation alerts make it so I never leave my wallet or keys at a restaurant again. Also, the customer service team is top notch!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received broken item
customer_reviews.text: I just got mine today and I was super excited to set it all up and when I went to turn on the actual device I noticed it looked like something was missing from the middle like a little hole or something and it wouldn’t turn on or do anything! I feel like I got a defective device or something!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Free battery replacement....but VERY short battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on January 7th, it’s March and I already have to replace the battery. Yes it’s free to replace, but I need to pay shipping. Not a big dollar amount but still, it’s only been 2 months. I don’t want to have to replace the battery every 2 months, that’s ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: barleypopmaker

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Far too expensive for what this is. Need to replace batteries once a year simply increases costs.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ewert

customer_reviews.title: Fragile, works at the price, okay app
customer_reviews.text: App set up was easy. I was able to use it pretty successfully when I had left my bag at a restaurant. It beeps pretty loud. The top covering the body did break and pop off almost immediately, I think within 2 weeks of purchase. For 5 bucks and some tape, it could work if you really don't have a choice. I bought this as a test run to see if having a tracker would be helpful to me, not for long term use.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. All arrived with dead batteries. One wouldn't even sync to my phone. The other two kept turning off and going off line. App is terrible and gets stuck. They don't track at all unless you are with the thing at all times. Defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: I love it. I had it on my keychain
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I had it on my keychain. I can locate it everywhere from the home, and vice versa. I can use the tracker to find my phone too. It is easy to install. It is especially useful for people like me looking for things a lot. I plan to get another one to put on my wallet. It is an useful product. Great for Christmas gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Shu-Hsin Hsieh

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: I set them up and everything looked fine, but after few hours two out of 3 showed disconnected, can’t get them back on, seems like they’re dead !
customer_reviews.author: Juan Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Good little surprise find!
customer_reviews.text: It is great each child had one attached to their school gear with a set of keys attached to their cell phones! It's beyond a relief to be able to monitor the location WITHOUT the invasion of privacy that the parent apps promote! We have a device for the kids to know our location as well!
customer_reviews.author: Bratty Bee💋

customer_reviews.title: dead battery and ordering from app is a deception
customer_reviews.text: batteries go much faster than advertised and ordering from app is not possible. an email to support is required meaning, there is no automation or certainty in this process. regretful but too late to return
customer_reviews.author: FastTraffik

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work when you need it; starts beeping and you can't stop it!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work when you need it; it's attached to my keys and the TrackR app says the device was last seen a month ago; on rare occasions, it starts beeping (or scree-ing; hi-pitched squeal) and you can't stop it! (I had to take the battery out). Most every time I've tried to actually find my keys, or my phone, it's been a fail.
customer_reviews.author: MarvinK

customer_reviews.title: They're okay, but don't expect them to find your drone
customer_reviews.text: They work. They don't work outside. I put it on my drone and crashed it in the forest. Walked past it within 10 feet with the trackr app open and in search mode, NOTHING. I know you guys are trying to improve the product as fast as you can, but the functionality just isn't quite there. Still better than a tile when it comes to batteries though :) (they sent me a free one after my first one died)
customer_reviews.author: realdavidmckee

customer_reviews.title: ... the battery on the first one I opened was bad and I would have to have contacted TrackR for ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned them as the battery on the first one I opened was bad and I would have to have contacted TrackR for a replacement. This was the second Pixel I had ordered where the battery was already dead. Maybe ordering them directly from TrackR and they may arrive without batteries already bad.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Grover

customer_reviews.title: I like “Tile” better
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like the lanyard it’s too long and like a leash, it gets caught up with other items. It would be better if it was designed to attach directly to a key ring like “Tile” alpso the ring is not that loud and I find at times I am right next to my keys and it takes several moments before my phone app “sees” the keys in order to ring it - overall so-so I think I prefer Tile
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these as a gift and kept one for myself. This item works far better than I expected. I have found my keys with it triple times and my girlfriend finds here keys and hospital badge frequently with it. The only downfall I see is that you have to keep the tracks app running to find your phone with the device. I still rate this a 5 star for the convenience of being able to find my keys. I like it so much I will be getting more.
customer_reviews.author: joshua Head

customer_reviews.title: Great for keys
customer_reviews.text: I got this to put on my keys. I had a problem with the first shipment I got. 2 of the 5 trackers didn't work, the button didn't work on them. I returned them and the new ones work great. These are also super useful if you can't find your phone but you have your keys. When you push the button it makes your phone ring.
customer_reviews.author: Camden

customer_reviews.title: Must have !!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the device so easy to use,it works to find your phone or your keys,which is what my pixel is attached too, your phone will ring even if you have it on silent,will definitely consider buying another one
customer_reviews.author: Julie Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Neat tool, crummy batteries
customer_reviews.text: My dad really liked the idea of this item! It’s very easy to use, but may not work as well with folks, like my father, who cannot hear high pitched sounds. In this case, they do still light up, but I was shocked to hear his disappointment over the fact that “it doesn’t make a sound”! Supposedly he did hear it after we minimized background noise. Also, I was disappointed that the batteries included died after only two weeks of use!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We were using the Tile but didn't like the "no battery replacement" feature and the fact that ...
customer_reviews.text: We were using the Tile but didn't like the "no battery replacement" feature and the fact that it would lose sync. So we went with the TrackR Pixel. After a few months of use here is my conclusion. 1. The alert is not as loud as the Tile. 2. They seem to be out of sync a lot as well. My wife will click it a few times and we don't hear anything. Sometimes we click it and it will work. No telling what it will do next time we need to use it..... We moved from the Tile hoping we found a better solution. But overall it has been a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lousy
customer_reviews.text: I was initially attracted by the small width of the TrackR (for my wallet) and the ability to change batteries, which saves me from buying a whole new device (like Tile requires). However, I have found the TrackR difficult to connect with my phone, delivered devices came with dead batteries, hard to access the battery and poor quality of the device. All in all, I have been quite frustrated and disappointed with TrackR.
customer_reviews.author: T-Berg

customer_reviews.title: Don't Stay Connected
customer_reviews.text: They're great when they work. First, only 4 out of the 5pk actually connected w my phone. So I got a dud. Fine, Amazon refunded me a portion of my purchase. Second, as time has passed, (I've had them for 1mo) they don't connect consistently. I put them on jackets and even if they're right next to me they aren't connected. That defeats the purpose of having a tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have a habit of misplacing my car keys this device does exactly what it's supposed to do has already helped me numerous times, like the fact that it's small enough to attach to keys without being too cumbersome
customer_reviews.author: EddieS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Love the idea pixels can be linked to different cells. I bought the eight pack and have shared with the family. GREAT feature to be able to click the pixel to create an audible on my cell....always misplacing it around the house and when in a hurry to leave, click, audible, cell phone found!!! Have not found anything wrong with what is promised. Customer service is A+.....called as well as the chat room....both excellent in answering my questions. I have had two others and gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: The gift that keeps giving!
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a christmas present for my boyfriend, if you’re debating these over tile GET THESE! My boyfriend works in construction so he has keys into a lot of important buildings where if the keys are lost they have to pay a HEFTY fine! Well, he showed these to the people in charge and they decided to buy them for all of there employees to keep track of these keys! What a great turn out for this company but hey, a product this great deserves it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Returned item twice. One of three discs didn’t pair. Bought another brand.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item TWICE and had to return both because in each lot, one of the three discs did not pair. I gave up, did some research and bought the Tiles brand which is a bit more but works. The sound of the Tiles is also louder.
customer_reviews.author: Target Regular Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy design, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Good experience overall, setup was easy and worked well for 2 months. Then the cover popped off and the small plastic led button fell out, so I could not use it. Contacted customer service and they sent a free replacement. Same thing happened again a few weeks later, I contacted customer service and waiting to hear back. If they send a free replacement I will use it again, but not willing to buy another one with the structural issues.
customer_reviews.author: David Evans

customer_reviews.title: Batteries Don’t Last
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this device. I ordered it as a gift for my wife and when she opened it to use it, the battery was dead. I didn’t think much of it, so I ran out and bought more batteries. I put the new battery in on 12/28 and the new battery was dead by the 4th. How am I supposed to find my device when the battery dies within days? Very disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Adams

customer_reviews.title: 2 of 3 defective
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a three pack of Trackr Pixels. Had difficulty logging into the app because although it accepted the password I entered, it claimed the same password was “invalid” when I tried to log in. After resetting to a new password that the system seemed to accept, I tried to pair the trackrs. One worked fine. One had a broken button so could not pair with my phone. The third made a chirping noise once when attempting to pair but otherwise failed and seemed dead. Not worth the trouble to spend time with tech support. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Pokorny

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is horrible
customer_reviews.text: I got this in the mail less then a week ago and the battery is already about to die, what a stupid product if you have to buy a new one every week. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Loud and helpful
customer_reviews.text: I'm not super confident in the string attachment. But it beeps loudly which is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie S

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life, difficult to maintain.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews for product because I believe as long as it does what if promises to do that is what I paid for. No accolades or negative criticism is needed. This product works, mostly but it is very difficult bordering on impossible to change the battery or reset the associated Bluetooth device. Create a tool or something to make it easy to change the battery not a learned trade. I bought a three pack and can’t use them. Wasting my time and money, will never purchase from this company again. FRUSTRATING.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I loose my keys or phone too ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I loose my keys or phone too much. I like how you can use your keys to find your phone too. I also like to notifications when I help others find their items (via crowd sourcing). It's a small size, lights up and loud enough to hear. The app also allows users to have the option to turn on/off the proximity feature, which is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Dre

customer_reviews.title: Batteries had less than 1/4th charge left immediately after the installation!
customer_reviews.text: While the product is of course good, I was most shocked to notice the batteries had less than 1/4th charge left immediately after the installation on my iPhone!!! Have deducted one star just because of this.
customer_reviews.author: sampat vijay

customer_reviews.title: this is much smaller and battery can be replaced easily. The location map doesn't always update but still ...
customer_reviews.text: After trying the Tiles and finding out I had to re-buy every year because the batter runs out, this is much smaller and battery can be replaced easily. The location map doesn't always update but still let's you know when you are getting closer to your tracker.
customer_reviews.author: dtb

customer_reviews.title: I ordered the multipak to give some as gifts. ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the multipak to give some as gifts. I kept one for myself and it works well. But, one I gave as a gift does not connect, and does not work. Since the one I kept seems to work, I don't want to as for a refund, but am not sure what I should do with some that may not/don't work. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Crap product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 5 pack because i have an escape artist. Out of the 5 pack only 2 turned on. They didnt light up. And they didnt show battery percentage on the app. Figured i got a bad batch. So i emailed amazon. They sent me a replacement. Only one turns on but doesnt connect and the others are dead. Wtf.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

product_meta.title: TrackR pixel - Bluetooth Tracking Device. Item Tracker. Phone Finder. iOS/Android Compatible - Black
product_meta.description: Style:01 Pack| Color:BlackTag your important items with the track pixel and let the track app keep track of everything for you. Use your phone to make your track pixel ring and light up, so you can find any misplaced item quickly. If you can’t find your phone, press the button on your track to make it ring. And when you’re far away from your missing item, track's crowd technology will confidentially update your app and Show your item’s last known location on the Map.
feature_bullets: Always losing things? TrackR is here to help! So small and lightweight, you can attach it to anything
TrackR uses Bluetooth technology to find items at close range—up to 100 feet away. Use the TrackR app to ring your device, now with flashing LED lights to help you find it fast
See where you last had your keys, wallet, laptop – on a map. TrackR's global Crowd Locate feature will alert you when your missing item has been spotted
Can't find your phone? Press the clear button on your TrackR to make your phone ring, even on silent mode
Free TrackR app download, compatible with iOS & Android. Try our Alexa Skill - just say: "Alexa, ask TrackR to find my phone"
Replace the battery, not the device – for free. The app will notify you when the battery is running low. Order a replacement directly from the app

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars1,668 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: TrackR pixel^CR2016 battery^key loop^adhesive sticker^setup guide
